title: Malcolm K. Read on Chomsky's reading of Juan Huarte de San Juan (Examen de ingenios)
description:
Profesor Malcolm K. Read talks about Chomsky's notion of a "creative subject", and the fact that such a subject is nowhere to be found in a Feudal, organicist text such as Huarte de San Juan's "Examen de ingenios", which Chomsky takes to be a precursor of his own innatist, generative theory of universal grammar. It is rather "bourgeois ideology" which is at play in 20th-century linguistics and it's unconscious discursive battle to produce a legitimate notion of individuality within capitalism; one that precisely relies on there being a set of conflicting notions of what is a "free subject" in Capitalism, the debate between innatism (the Kantian subject) and behaviorism (the Empiricist subject) being one instance of such unconscious ideological struggle.

For a longuer context of Professor Read's remarks, see part five (V) of this interview: https://youtu.be/TWmQGF9XBSA
